DataElement.preferredName: Deep Vein Thrombosis Prevention Therapy Warfarin Received Ind-2
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the yes/no/unknown indicator whether the patient received coumadin as prophylactic treatment for deep vein thrombosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Deep Vein Thrombosis Prevention Therapy Warfarin Received
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the action of havin received the administration of warfarin, a synthetic anticoagulant, to prevent the formation of blood clots in the deep veins of the extremities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A blood clot (thrombus) in a deep vein in the thigh or leg.:An attempt to prevent disease.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: A blood clot in a deep vein, predominantly in the lower extremity, but may include the pelvis or upper extremity.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Property.preferredDefinition: A synthetic anticoagulant. Warfarin appears to inhibit the regeneration of vitamin K1 epoxide and so the synthesis of vitamin K dependent clotting factors, which include Factors II, VII, IX and X, and the anticoagulant proteins C and S. This inhibition results in a sequential depression of Factors VII, IX, X and II activities. Vitamin K is an essential cofactor for the post ribosomal synthesis of the vitamin K dependent clotting factors. The vitamin promotes the biosynthesis of gamma-carboxyglutamic acid residues in these proteins which are essential for biological activity. (NCI04):Received; taken, gotten, or acquired.

Concepts.definition: A synthetic anticoagulant. Warfarin inhibits the regeneration of vitamin K1 epoxide and so the synthesis of vitamin K dependent clotting factors, which include Factors II, VII, IX and X, and the anticoagulant proteins C and S. This inhibition results in a sequential depression of Factors VII, IX, X and II activities. Vitamin K is an essential cofactor for the post ribosomal synthesis of the vitamin K dependent clotting factors. The vitamin promotes the biosynthesis of gamma-carboxyglutamic acid residues in these proteins which are essential for biological activity.
To take, accept, or get something offered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
